intro: Scutellaria yunnanensis var. cuneata, commonly known as the Yunnan cuneate skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with lanceolate to ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are tubular and blue or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
